overview.title: User Management Overview
overview.content:
The User Management system allows administrators to manage all user accounts, roles, and permissions within the platform.

Key Features:

  • View and search all users
  • Edit user profiles and roles
  • Manage account status (active/inactive)
  • Bulk operations for multiple users
  • CSV import/export functionality

User Roles:

  • ADMIN: Full system access
  • GIANG_VIEN (Teacher): Course and class management
  • HOC_VIEN (Student): Learning access only

roles.title: User Roles and Permissions
roles.content:
Understanding user roles is crucial for proper system administration.

Administrator (ADMIN)

  • Full access to all system features
  • User management and role assignment
  • System configuration and monitoring
  • Analytics and reporting

Teacher (GIANG_VIEN)

  • Course and lesson management
  • Class scheduling and enrollment
  • Quiz creation and grading
  • Student progress tracking

Student (HOC_VIEN)

  • Course enrollment and learning
  • Quiz taking and progress viewing
  • Profile management

creation.title: Creating and Managing Courses
creation.content:
Course management is central to the learning platform. Here's how to effectively create and manage courses.

Creating a New Course:

  1. Click the 'Create Course' button
  2. Fill in required information (title, description, course code)
  3. Assign a teacher to the course
  4. Add lessons and content
  5. Set up class schedules

Course Components:

  • Lessons: Individual learning units with content
  • Classes: Scheduled learning sessions
  • Assignments: Tasks for students to complete
  • Quizzes: Assessment tools

lessonEditor.title: Lesson Content Editor
lessonEditor.content:
The lesson content editor provides rich text editing capabilities for creating engaging learning content.

Features:

  • Rich text formatting (bold, italic, lists, etc.)
  • Image and video embedding
  • File attachments
  • Flashcard integration
  • Preview functionality

Best Practices:

  • Use clear headings to structure content
  • Include multimedia to enhance learning
  • Add interactive elements like flashcards
  • Preview content before publishing

builder.title: Quiz Builder Guide
builder.content:
The quiz builder allows you to create comprehensive assessments for your courses.

Question Types:

  • Multiple Choice: Single or multiple correct answers
  • Fill in the Blank: Text input questions
  • Essay: Long-form written responses
  • True/False: Simple binary questions

Quiz Settings:

  • Time limits and attempts
  • Randomization options
  • Grading and feedback settings
  • Availability dates

Tips:

  • Use a mix of question types
  • Provide clear instructions
  • Include explanations for answers
  • Test your quiz before publishing

student.title: Student Analytics and Progress Tracking
student.content:
Monitor student progress and performance with comprehensive analytics tools.

Available Metrics:

  • Course completion rates
  • Quiz scores and trends
  • Time spent learning
  • Engagement levels
  • Learning path progress

Reports:

  • Individual Progress: Detailed student performance
  • Class Overview: Aggregate class statistics
  • Course Analytics: Course-wide performance metrics
  • Comparative Analysis: Cross-course comparisons

Using Analytics:

  • Identify struggling students early
  • Adjust teaching methods based on data
  • Track improvement over time
  • Generate reports for stakeholders
